oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Congregation Sherith Israel
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Congregation Sherith Israel, an Orthodox Jewish synagogue, acquired property in 1948 on West End Avenue. The congregation moved from its Fifth Avenue building to the new location in April of 1948. Zalman Posner, longtime rabbi to the synagogue, also founded Akiva school specifically designed for the education of Jewish children. The school was originally located in the synagogue on West End but was later relocated. 3 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Congregation Sherith Israel
Architecture; Churches
Nashville (Tenn.); Fifth Avenue; West End Avenue
